snippet: Steel from the World Trade Center site will no longer be handled by Gov. Chris Christie’s political appointees at the Port Authority, but by the agency’s professional staff.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column notes steel from the World Trade Center site will no longer be handled by New Jersey Gov Chris Christie’s political appointees at the Port Authority, but by agency’s professional staff; says Christie, who is uninhibited in deploying the tools of whatever office he was in to serve his own ends, would travel the state to personally deliver tons of the steel to politically important towns.
lead_paragraph: Steel from the World Trade Center site will no longer be handled by Gov. Chris Christie’s political appointees at the Port Authority, but by the agency’s professional staff.

headline.main: Removing 9/11 Artifacts From New Jersey’s Nest of Political Patronage
headline.print_headline: Removing 9/11 Artifacts From New Jersey’s Nest of Political Patronage

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
